section.name: Referencing topics
section.p: Several semantag-tags needs to identify a topic. Since topicmaps supports various ways to identify topics, we decided to make a generic set of attributes that allow you to specify what topic you mean.

section.name: Attributes
section.p: The following common attributes allow you to identify a topic unambigously

tr.td: the id of a topic. If and how ids are assigned to topics depends on the topicmap engine.
the name of a topic. Keep in mind, that names in topicmaps are unique just for a distinct scope. This attribute is not implemented in Semantag 0.1
identifies a topic by the address of one of its sourceLocator
identifies a topic by the address of its subject
identifies a topic by the address of one of its subjectIndicators

section.name: Tags
section.p: The following topics allow the usage of the topic referencing attributes

ul.li: <addInstanceOf> - the topic referencing attributes are used to identify the type
<addPlayer> - the topic referencing attributes are used to identify the player
<addScope> - the topic referencing attributes are used to identify the theme
<useTopic> the topic referencing attributes are used to identify the topic
